meanings.definition: The quality or state of being white.
meanings.sent1: The whitenesses of the snow made everything look magical.
meanings.sent2: The whitenesses of the clouds contrasted beautifully against the blue sky.
meanings.sent3: The chef was amazed by the whitenesses of the whipped cream he created.
meanings.sent4: Her wedding dress shimmered with the pure whitenesses of fresh snow.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the delicate whitenesses of the lily petals in his painting.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is white in color.
meanings.sent1: The bathroom tiles' whitenesses made the room feel clean and bright.
meanings.sent2: The painter mixed different shades to achieve the perfect whitenesses for the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur showed off its whitenesses against the dark furniture.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph had faded, losing its original whitenesses over time.
meanings.sent5: The doctor was impressed by the patient's teeth whitenesses after the treatment.
